In light of this admission, I must confess that Loving Hut has given me serious pause to re-evaluate my views on a vegan diet. Not only was this hands down the best vegan food I've ever experienced, it was simply a superb meal no matter your tastes or dietary affiliations.  The interior is clean, modern, and inviting. Grab a menu and order at the counter when you're ready. They'll bring the food to the table when it's done. The menu offers a varied selection, from burgers and fries to Asian and Indian inspired cuisine, at very reasonable prices. The staff was welcoming, friendly, and helpful.   I ordered the Kung Pao and my wife had the Spicy Cha Cha. Our food was delivered quickly. The Kung Pao was spicy and incredibly flavorful, and the meatless chicken was truly good (again, I'm a meat eater, so this is high praise indeed) with an excellent texture and taste. My wife loved the Spicy Cha Cha, commenting that it wasn't as spicy as the name implied but delicious all the same.   We also ordered the hot chrysanthemum tea, which was wonderfully floral but not overwhelmingly so. Nicely balanced.  I very recently began flirting with veganism. Loving Hut was an eye opening dining experience, demonstrating that I don't have to "sacrifice" the pleasure of a tasty meal in order to kick my carnivorous tendencies. If you're like me, undecided about taking the plunge into the vegan pool, do yourself a favor and try Loving Hut. I think you'll find the water's just fine!

For my first time,so far so good. I ordered the spicy pad thai noodles and added bok choy to it. The pad thai was good,a tad bit too much ginger in it and it could be a little sweeter. But,overall,it tasted very good for being vegan. I will add that I am not a vegan,and this place has impressed me. I will be coming back to it.  I also ordered the iced mumbai chai. It was very delicious.  Bottom line,I will definitely be coming back. Even if you're not a vegan,give this place a try. Worth it! :)

I am not a vegan or vegetarian, but health conscious when I can be. I loved the new foods and different flavors. If I can back, it would have to be without my husband since he was less than sold on the place.. Loved the flavored water!

Loved this place so much !! I had the amazing bbq noodles and the rolls with avacado. My husband had the Mongolian "beef" and he said it was the best Mongolian beef he's ever had ! Love this place. Such a vegan gem

Yes this is a vegan house !! But if I didn't tell you , you would have never known. Everything here is good. The lemon grass soups are very refreshing. Very good alternative to eating meat. Do your body a flavor hahah ( I know that was dumb) Chill on the meats once in a while. When you do you will thank me and your cardiovascular system will too ..... Come to think of it the animals will thank you to ( I know corny hehe )

Decided to try this place out on a whim, and we were so pleasantly surprised! As soon as we walked in were we greeted and welcomed, very friendly. The menu and options were explained to us. So many delicious choices! We just started eating vegan and so we have a lot to learn about recipes and variety of foods to eat. We ordered the Hawaiian burger (amazing), vermicelli bowl, beefless sandwich and the carrot cake (amazing). Everything tasted so good, we will definitely be back! Also loved the staff - very friendly, explained ingredients and were patient with questions. They also have cooking videos playing on how to cook vegan food. Loved the atmosphere. Thank you for a great experience!
Their food was delicious, not disappointing at all. Will definitely be a regular. My favorite item was the "oink in the blanket" lol

Loving hut is one of those places you go to that you know is divinely inspired.  The food was excellent, the wait staff was extremely friendly and very caring.  Beautiful inside and out.  Carrot juice was the best I have had in a long time (I know it is just carrot juice).  You could tell it was made with love though.  Highly recommend the super delicious vegetarian food at this fine establishment.

For some reason I thought this little vegan restaurant was a craft store. I have no idea why that impression came to me, but it was probably because of the logo.   My boyfriend and I found this place on yelp, and once my craft store assumptions were put to rest we decided to try it. We ordered two appetizers, two main dishes, and a dessert-- all for $20! Everything was fantastic! And I can't wait to go back for seconds!  Someone commented on the lack of atmosphere, which is understandable, however, it is important to remember that this establishment offers cheap, delicious, vegan food. I think the fact that it resembles an IKEA is forgivable if we take these truths to heart.

Disclaimer: I am not a vegan or a vegetarian.  But I do love eating vegetarian every once in a while.  That being said, this place is not bad.  I think that its a little weird that they make soy/plant protein look like meat, I'd prefer just tofu rather than a weird textured, processed protein patty.  My girlfriend's eggplant was delicious.  I got a combo that came with a stir-fry and a fried protein patty.  The stir fry was good, but the protein patty really had a weird texture to it.    However, none of the food had anything on the chai tea.  Freaking delicious.  I've been looking for a good chai tea since I moved here from Texas, and this place knows how to make a good chai.  Most of the chai you get around here is in a latte form (too sweet and not enough spice).  It was a little on the expensive side $3 (I think), but I would come back just for the Chai.

Time for a review update... My initial "oh-my-god-there's-a-vegan-restaurant-a-mile-from-my-house" infatuation is now over. I live very close to LH, so I go there a lot.  Loving Hut is pretty good, they have some very tasty dishes (Spicy Cha Cha, BBQ Bagutte are some of my favs) and they have some not so great dishes.  The real reason for my drop-down in stars is that it's always a pain in the arse to order what you want at Loving Hut. You would think that a vegan restaurant would be totally okay with substitutions, omissions, etc (as that's what vegans must do at most restaurants), but no, it's always a royal pain at loving hut.  The other day my wife wanted to try the "Tuno" (faux tuna) sandwich on the baguette roll instead of sliced bread. I called in to place a phone order and tried to order it. I made it clear that I would be happy to pay a bit extra for the baguette bread if necessary. Didn't matter. They would not do it. No way, no how. I tried to bargain with the phone employee who blamed it on someone else and said she had to go "check with the cook" if it was possible. How would it not be possible to use a different type of bread that they already have? Either way, they would not budge at all. So I couldn't get what I wanted, very annoying and frustrating.  I've also tried other substitutions and dish modifications and it's always a pain.  They no longer give free refills on Iced Tea (citing costs), which is disappointing.  One day I asked about the complementary appetizer soups that they give in store, asking if I could get it for to go orders. The employee I spoke with explained that they don't give it out on to go orders because of soup container costs, but if I brought in my own soup container they'd be happy to give me some. So the next time I placed a to go order, I brought in a little plastic soup bowl and requested some. They barely gave me any soup in it and they gave me a hard time about it.  Bottom line is that they need to be better at providing what the customer wants and less about penny pinching, as it is very annoying and it does not make me want to go back.  Changing up the menu by offering unique, limited time dish specials would also greatly improve the place, as much of the menu seems to be very similar (the same flavored soy protein is in just about everything).  Hoping they can improve...

I went visited Loving Hut again tonight. We ordered a few different things, including the pho I mentioned in my last review.  Everything was delicious. They made my pho with tofu rather than the soy meats and they actually suggested extra vegetables. It was so delicious!  Thanks Loving Hut!

I like their food as a healthier alternative when I am trying to be healthy.  I like everything about them except that some tables have a sticky feeling like its dirty.  They told me it is from the laquers for the decals.  I wish they would replace those tables, so I just pick a different one.  Everyone there is nice and I have never had a bad experience (except for the disliking SOME of the tables)

Every time I go past this restaurant I stop, it is very clean, the foods are organic and delicious, the staff is very friendly, even in the clientele is very passive due to eating a good diet this is a nice place to dine,

Made it out to this Loving Hut during my last trip to Arizona. I was in NEED of some fried soy protein goodness. So at this location, you walk in, grab the menu, order at the front, and then sit down with a number. They'll bring the food to your table once your order is ready.   What we ordered: golden nuggets, save the planet curry,  amazing saute, and royal spicy noodle. Oh my goodness, the golden nuggets were SO good. Definitely something I would order again, especially if I'm craving fried food. My friends seemed like the save the planet curry. It does cost a few dollars to add noodles, naan, or rice to the curry, but the portion is giant so I feel like it's worth the price. The royal spicy noodle was good, but had a super strong lemongrass flavor. If lemongrass is not your friend, I would stay away from it. The star of the show for me was definitely the amazing saute. The chickless soy protein was tossed in a delicious sauce with a bunch of onions and green peppers which are literally two of my favorite veggies. I would highly recommend it!  Service was great overall and I felt like the staff was super helpful. I would highly recommend going to this place if you get a chance!

My mom and I tried this restaurant at the recommendation of my hairstylist and I have to say, it did not disappoint. We were seated quickly and our waitress was both friendly and helpful in answering our questions about the menu. It's not always easy to find delicious vegetarian food, but with dishes like the Saigon Rolls and the Hawaiian Burger using plantbased proteins, you don't miss real meat at all. My favorite thing there is actually the Pink Lady drink made with cranberry juice, vanilla soy milk and topped with pretty rose petals.

I have been here a few times and each time I've had a stellar meal. I came here a few days ago with my boyfriend and got the spring rolls and spicy Pad Thai. Everything we had was soooooo tasty. I love that you get a little bowl of soup at the beginning of the meal.   The spring rolls are fried and have a wonderful dipping sauce. The vegetables inside tasted great. My spicy Pad Thai was amazing. The heat was just right and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The food was so good we both said we could eat here every day.   The staff was super attentive and friendly. If you're in the mood for great vegan food or you want to try out vegan food this place will now disappoint!
I gave up meat on Friday's for lent. My first time to loving hut and had spicy pad thai. I really liked it. Service was nice too. I'll be back

Interesting crowd of people, weird decor and too many peace/love/save the animals propaganda everywhere.  I ordered the golden rolls which were very tasty as an appetizer. For entree, I ordered the Save the Planet Curry. It was gross. It was lukewarm, claimed to have tofu which I pretty much found 2 pieces and the curry taste was very very bland. Its scary when you can't decipher what is what in your curry "soup" because it all is covered in the lukewarm yellow "curry" sauce. I was really craving curry and this didn't help. Do not order the bread, order rice because otherwise you have no substance for a meal except a small piece of indian bread. My girlfriend ordered the hawaiian burger which was a lot better than mine and Im the vegan and this place is supposed to be known for their ethnic food??? The menu has a lot to offer but either their photos don't do justice or the descriptions of the food isn't very appealing. Not sure when i'll come back since nothing on the menu stood out to me or looked "amazing."   Half their desserts weren't available, so I ended up with the chocolate cake which was dry.

I LOVED this place! I have been a vegetarian for over 7 years and this was my first time going to an all-vegetarian/vegan restaurant.  It's so amazing being able to order anything off of the menu.  The menu is full of different types of meat substitutes which is great, not just vegetables on a plate.  Everything was delicious, I can't wait to go back and try everything off of the menu.

To say that I was floored by the Loving Hut would be an understatement.  I had the Save the World Curry (which was essentially a yellow curry) and it was AMAZING!.  My friend and I also drank the green tea: it was so clean and fresh and authentic.  The service was friendly and attentive.  As someone who is not vegan, I was impressed by the pleasant flavor and texture of the food: I didn't miss the meat at all.    I can't wait to go back!

It's been over 10 years since I've become a vegetarian & had Pho. My mom & I were in town for a short getaway & I am so thankful to have found this restaurant. Talk about LOVING!??? We started off with the wonderful lentil soup (on the house no less) and then went on to the spring rolls (gone in 60 seconds!). My soup was better than I remembered & from the silence across from me, my mom's BBQ Vermicelli was excellent as well. We spoke to one of the women behind this restaurant & she was so gracious and happy to see our bellies full of love. I swear it felt like this place changed me from the inside out & I needed it. I hope they come to Chicago very soon, we need some LOVE here too!

I tried LH last week before thier Grand Opening. I was definatly surprised by the various types of dishes they offered.   I opted to chicken out and get the fried rice with soy chicken. IT WAS GREAT.   They mentioned that the steak wrap and burger are the best tasting dishes but I was a little bit afraid to eat a fake burger. lol  They offered me a couple glasses of Lemonade while I waited and it might have been the best I have ever had.   The prices seemed reasonable and the place was spotless.   I will be back and maybe I can raise it one more star.
This place is the bomb! The food is so good and you don't even know you are eating vegan. We had the pho soup, rice bowl, and side dish of amazing sauté and Saigon rolls! YUM!

Non-Vegan Veggie Lover writing this!   The decor is pretty lackluster BUT my sister has been a fan of Loving Hut ever since she took on a Vegan diet. I had the Mumbai Chai which is an experience in and of itself. By far the BEST chai I've ever had! My only complaint was that I saw the bottom of the milkshake glass it's served in FAR too soon.   I also ordered the vermicelli bowl (like I would at most any vietnamese restaurant). The golden rolls that were served with it had a strange texture to me, almost a sogginess to the inside but my sister swears by them. The rest of the vermicelli bowl was spot on though!  Even the faux meat was very tasty and I found it to be more filling than the other versions I have had.   4 because it was crowded at dinner time and a little slow. Also, not a lot of smiles from the servers. My sister says they are usually friendly when she goes.

Absolutely love this place!  I've gone there twice now and everything I've had so far has been delicious.  I've had several items off the menu and have no complaints on any of them.  The ones that stand out for me are the Hawaiian burger, the spicy cha cha and the iced Mumbai chai.  I can positively say that I'll be back again for some more delicious food.

I have been to many Loving Huts and this one has the largest menu in the Valley. I often get the Golden Vermicelli and it never lets me down we were celebrating so I also got a piece of chocolate cake which I have been dreaming about ever since. Sadly this location is not close to me so there won't be any frequent trips but whenever I am in the area I will stop by. Heads up all Loving Huts close during the middle of the day and reopen for dinner check the hours before you stop by.

Loving Hut was recommended by an acquaintance, so I ventured out with my daughter to experience something new. I was pleasantly surprised how good the food was and you wouldn't even realize it was vegan. Great selection, great flavors and nice atmosphere! I will definitely return.

If you're into vegan foods or are vegan, you'll love this place! I've been here at least 4 times and every time is amazing. My favorite is the Buddy burger with seasoned fancy fries. Everything here is 100% vegan and tasty. Waiting for food might take awhile but in the end, it's worth it. I would recommend this place to anyone.
Fantastic VEGAN food, clean nice environment, great wait service. And you can buy groceries too. I was very impressed and so happy to find this place in North Phoenix!

I am always thrilled to see a vegan restaurant and will come here when in the area. The low stars are for a few reasons. First there are way too many processed fake meats on the menu. Hard to avoid them. Second, everything is an upcharge. Third, the veggies are not the star of the plates. Very limited options and my lunch today was cabbage, carrots and broccoli. Boring and mainly cabbage. I love the concept but untill there are better whole food choices I cant give it a higher rating.

One word: AWESOME. Only wish they were closer to my house in Buckeye. :) Have eaten here once...I got a chicken dish. It was the best faux chicken I think I've ever had. This place is such a refreshing change to all the other predictable meat-and-potatoes chain restaurants in the area. Two thumbs up!

I came to the loving hut for lunch today! I think the food was good! I had the Hawaiian Burger! It tasted good! The reason I gave it 4 stars is because the service was slow! The iced coffee was just okay! I would have liked to see some fresh juice options that don't include so much sugar! All their juices are fruit juices full of sugar!

I tried this place twice. It was fantastic. I got the pho, spring rolls and pandan cake. The pho was delish! I am not the biggest fan of fake make but it was good. The portion size was hearty as well. The spring rolls had crispy vegetables and good as well. The cake was sweet and moist. I would buy all three again.  I returned a day later and bought chow mien with no fake meat, extra tofu. It was awesome! There was a a lot of veggies broccoli, cauliflower, onions, carrots, cabbage and bok choy. I will definitely be back. Its a different atmosphere then the one on Indian school.

I have to admit I was a little worried about going to a "vegan" restaurant but I was wrong. This is a hidden paradise inside! I had the Pad Thai with Tofu and it was amazing! My friend and I shared a piece of chocolate cake for dessert that was equally delicious.  I look forward to visiting again soon!

This was a VERY PLEASANT surprise.  The food was phenomenal and the service was excellent.  I had never been to an all vegetarian restaurant let alone a vegan.  My lunch companion is a vegetarian and she had nothing but praise for this place.  We shared the 'Spicy Cha Cha' and the 'Sweet & Sour Devine'.  One word ... YUMM-O for both.  We left saying that we had to return SOON.
Their mock chicken is amazing, the golden rolls with sweet and sour... YUM YUM!! And the Pandan cake is divine.
The food is absolutely amazing every time I eat here and the service is awesome! Everyone is so nice and friendly. Recommend 100%

We stopped in for dinner tonight after reading the reviews on how awesome this place was, and never having actually had gone to a vegan/vegetarian restaurant, this place is delicious. It's true about the wait on how long the food takes to come out, it does take a little while but it's totally worth it. You can tell it's all super fresh and made to order. We will definitely be back!!

You might think there is nothing on the menu at this quaint little vegan restaurant that children would go for.  Depending on how picky your kids are, you may be right.  My kids will eat plain white rice, spaghetti with sauce and french fries, though.  This was my second visit.  I took my nearly 4 year old with me.  She likes the soup, ate spring rolls, pasta and had a smoothie.  I had a pleasant vegan lunch.  The people here are always friendly and calm - there's no feeling like you have to race through your meal so they can get the table back.  That being said, this isn't fast food so you do have to wait for it and I haven't tried the takeout so I don't know if you could eat and be out in 30 minutes.  They prefer if you pay in cash - I was thanked specifically for it today.  You order at the register and pay and they bring the food to your table.  There are a lot of vegan/vegetarian promotion signs, books, etc here so if you are bringing a meat eater who would be offended by the "propaganda" be aware of that.  Personally, I think if they are willing to try a vegan restaurant in the first place they won't be too upset about it.  The food is good, but I prefer the non-meat-substitute entrees like pad Thai and Spring Rolls over the "burgers."

Ventured here on a weekday night to test out the vegetarian / vegan food.  We had the spring rolls- it was not that good, just average. Have had much better. Needed to use a lot of sauce to give it a taste.  Mumbai ice tea was pretty good!  Pad thai- solid, but the noodles were not tasty. However, they used a lot of carrots and other vegetables.   Soy meat noodles - something like a brocoli and beef but the vegetarian style. pretty solid. seemed fresh.  We came about 30 minutes before closing time but while we were eating the server asked us to take our dishes. made us feel unwelcome and rushed. that was not very professional.

I am so excited yet so sad! I'm so excited I found this gem but so sad it took this long! I am in love with this place!  My mom and I came here today for lunch! The staff was so nice and very helpful since it was our first time there. The atmosphere was very relaxing and it was extremely clean.  I loved all the options you could do for with each dish! SFO and GFO!! So great!!  Veggie pho- this is the SFO option and it was delicious!! We loved adding the hoisin sauce for extra flavor! Not that it need it!   Blissful fried rice- amazing!!! Taste was great! We got this GFO. It came out just right!  Banana cake- THIS. IS. HEAVEN. We loved it! The icing tasted like butter! The cake part was perfection, moist and light.  I am beyond excited to come back and try out all the other vegan options, especially the desserts!! This is truly a diamond in the rough!

Love me some Loving Hut!  Believe it or not, I went to this Loving Hut before going to the one in my hometown!  I love the location of this restaurant, close to my work, which is typically why I visit Phoenix.  The restaurant itself is decent sized with plenty of seating.  I love the educational décor and the grocery freezers with vegan goodies including faux meats and other treasures.  They also have some vegan dog food, clothing and accessories.  Always a plus!  As for the food.  Yum!  Every time I have been here I have enjoyed the food!  I enjoy that they have a traditional American food menu including burgers and spaghetti?!  It's nice to have a place that you can get a nice big bowl of vegan pho and go back the next day for a vegan chilidog!    I have some favorite vegan Vietnamese restaurants in Sacramento that still take the cake as far as "favorites" go, but Loving Hut is a blessing while I am traveling on business!
Great Vegan food. Well priced and nice staff. Very impressed.  They even have Vegan Hot Dogs   It's very clean ..I definitely recommend it.

Wonderful staff and I love that they have soy free options. It is extremely hard to come across that in vegan restaurants. My food was okay, and my boyfriend loved his pho. I do think we'll be coming back simply because he loves pho and the workers were all very nice.  Edit: We came back a few more times and have realized that the food is really hit or miss. The beef & brocolli and pho are great, but some of the other items like the chow mein missed the mark for us.
This is one of my favorite restaurants, try the guru fried rice, save the planet curry, or buddy burger! Great place to take vegan or non vegan friends.

As a vegan this place makes my heart sing!! The food is delicious, the staff are supper nice, and what the company stands for makes this restaurant one of my favorite places to go. I bring my non-vegan friends here and they love it as well! Most dishes you wouldn't even know are vegan! I would recommend this place to anyone and if you like Asian style dishes get the Golden BBQ Bowl.

Sad to say, not a good experience today... it was not the food... well sorta the food, or lack thereof. Ordered 2 entrees, one came out and about 10 minutes later, still no 2nd entree... wasn't even started or if it was, it was Just started. It's rude to eat when someone else was still waiting. We were told different stories, from "they can't tell the cooks how to prepare a tables order" so they can go out at the same time, to, one person cooks this entree and another person cooks the other entree... then it was that they have new people working in the kitchen. We got the money back and they kept both orders... the one that was cold and the other that took an addition 15 minutes to show up after we asked for a refund. Loved the place.. the food is Awesome, no if ands or buts, but there were too many excuses this trip and we had to ask where the other entree was... if they knew they were behind, let the customer know... ask if it would be ok to serve one without the other order, hold the one order till the second one is ready... something... not assume it's acceptable. Does anyone know of another vegan place???

Guru Fried Rice, delicious. Pate chaud, delicious. Pad Thai, delicious. Everything here is great tasting and cruelty free. The only things I haven't really tried are the vegan American foods such as the hotdogs and spaghetti. Mainly because the Asian inspired are more what  they are known for. My mom also bought the soup broth packet from their market section and it came out wonderful tasting. Just throw in your favorite veggies and you're good to go!

Living in San Francisco I would frequently see this place, but would always decide on a non-chain veg place instead. Here in Az it's a lot harder to find an all vegetarian or vegan place! So I went. All in all, it was pretty good, the portions on some of the things were kind of small and I'm pretty sure they use a boca burger in the hawaiian burger, and boca burgers have a foul taste to them. The sauce and accompaniments definitely made up for it, though. The sushi rolls I would not get again, they had a fake ham in them, which doesn't even make sense to me and I didn't like. Their sweet and sour mock was really great as was the curry and the soup they give at the beginning. The drinks were fabulous but they didn't have their vegan ice cream that day, which was a major bummer. I will definitely be going there again when I'm in the vicinity, but stay clear of those sushi rolls!

I ate here after eating at the one in San Diego a couple times.  I was a little disappointed.  The place was kind of depressing and slow moving, but I was there at 8:15 on a Tuesday.  Overall, the food wasn't that good.  I had one of the soups and it was just okay.  I would definitely be willing to give this place another shot, though.  I really liked some of the stuff at the SD location and I would like to try it here.  If you have never been to a Loving Hut, it is worth a visit to see the crazy TV channel and some of the inventive dishes.  I strongly recommend the things that look like breaded chicken legs but are really filled with mushrooms.  That thing is tasty.

I decided to give this place a try since my husband decided to be a vegetarian this year. The server asked if I wanted my beverages while I waited for my to go order. I ordered the hibiscus and Chai tea...for food I ordered the curry, fried rice and chow mein...the curry was ok. Couldn't eat the fried rice just wasn't good but my husband like the chow mein. It was a long wait more than 25 minutes we waited and I didn't get my drinks til AFTER we got our food. The Chai was good but it was in a tiny cup and less than half full. The hibiscus was blah. Don't think we'll be coming back.
I won't say food is something to die for but the ladies were very polite. I tried the Thai cury and it was OK ok types.  The dessert was not good.  A very average restaurant.

How does a little Vegan place exist in the West Valley and I have never heard of it? How does this happen?  Well, last night I had my Loving Hut cherry popped.  I know vegetarians can understand how exciting it is to go to a restaurant and be able to order anything off the menu. You forget that feeling and it's so nice to have it back at times. Thank you, places like Loving Hut.    Most of the menu is Asian-esque, but there is a random spaghetti on the menu which I was drawn to. The homemade sauce included onions, green peppers, little bits of tofu and other tastiness. The sauce was awesome.  With every meal, you get a simple soup (my dining partner and I were unaware of this until it was brought to us) which warms your throat a little.  We also ordered the spring rolls which were a solid choice.  My friend ordered the lo mein and raved about her meal. Loving Hut is a great little place to get your veg on.  I'm sure I'll be a regular.
Great vegan food that has a lot of taste. Very clean place with welcoming atmosphere! One of my favorites.

I've been here twice now and I like what this place stands for and that they offer a full vegan menu. The people are really nice too. I just wished they offered vegan options that don't have fake meat or tofu.

I had the spicy veggie wrap with green tea.  The wrap had good flavor and the tea was light and delicious.   I also bought some vegetarian bacon to try.  I think the wrap could have used some kind of veggie cheese as it was a little vinegar-like for my taste buds, but I did like it.  There was a mix of great vegetables and a slight spice came through but also a sweet twang was in it that I didn't like.  Anyway, the ingredients are high quality and I have been here many times for delicious healthy food.  Next time I'll go back to my usual fried items and curries.  This place is great!

This place wasn't to bad, didn't care for the food as much as I do other vegan restaurants. I got a small bowl of chili, and it was small o right. The fries are really good though, but other than that, wasn't my favorite.
Great food, great staff, great atmosphere. Will definitely come back again! They also have vegan merchandise

My husband and I have been here about 5 times now.  I am not a strict vegetarian, but I am very "veggie-inclined."  :)  My husband is a full-blown meat-eater.  And... we both love this place.  I agree that their choice of television entertainment is a little weird, and it was a little distracting on our first visit.  But the volume is almost inaudible and it's really easy to tune out.  We have tried multiple dishes there: spring rolls, sushi appetizer, an egg-roll/bbq vermicelli, lemongrass chicken, hawaiian burger, steak sandwich, eggplant tofu, and pho.  My favs so far have been the spring rolls, vermicelli, steak sandwich (this is amazingly realistic and very very tasty), and eggplant.  I am a pretty big eater, and I've never left this place hungry (I suggest an appetizer though).  My husband always gets some fancy brightly-colored drink... and like a previous reviewer mentioned, since there are no descriptions on the drink menu you are always taking a gamble with that.  I stick to iced tea and am always satisfied with it.    I've never had to wait long for my food, and it has always been fresh and hot.  We do usually go for dinner though, and at that time there are generally only 2-3 other groups of people there.  I hope for their sake the business is better for lunch.  One complaint I've had so far was that they have been closed on Sunday (eliminating the Sunday lunch crowd) but they are shifting their hours soon and will be open 7 days a week.  Overall I highly recommend this place to anyone with an open mind.  I know we'll keep going back!

We got take out the other day and it was delicious. We love the variety they offer and that they asked us if we wanted disposable utensils or not (instead of just assuming we did). Also it's exclusively vegan food which is hard to find.

One of the fun things about Loving Huts is they are all different. Each has its own menu, and even items that are the same on the menu may be prepared differently. The Glendale franchise is one of the more interesting versions of the vegan franchise in the valley. It seems to have more pro-vegan signage than the others, and I think has modified the menu more than others. Like all Loving Huts, the menu is predominantly Asian food, but the burgers are also a big draw for plant-based eaters. Non-veg eaters may be put-off by the pro-vegan lifestyle advocacy messages throughout the restaurant (menu, walls, TVs, etc.), but the food is so good that hopefully it affirms diners' choices to go veg for at least one meal!  The Glendale location is a counter-serve restaurant, which means I usually try to review the menu online and make a decision before going in. I think it has the largest variety of menu items of the franchises in the valley, but there are some items that Indian School restaurant offers that Glendale doesn't, such as the won ton soup (and free lentil soup with lunch). But the Glendale location has a wider variety of pastries, and has some items not at Indian School such as a Chipotle mock fried chicken sandwich, BBQ rolls and golden nuggets. I haven't been to the Litchfield Park location yet to know what they offer.  My normal go-to in Glendale is the chow mein. A server once told me the noodles are hand made locally - and you can tell. They're fantastic. The light brown sauce is also great. I've pretty much been stuck on it for years. It's basic, but delicious.   On my most recent visit, I wanted to try something different. I started with the Oink in a Blanket (vegan hot dogs in croissants with vegan cheese and bacon), which isn't available at the Tempe or Indian School locations. The Glendale location makes great croissants, so I thought these might be good. The croissant around the dogs was nice - light but chewy. The hot dogs were sliced up a bit thin. There was nothing wrong with them, but they weren't stand-outs. They'd be great for kids.  My favorite item on the Indian School menu is the Pad Thai, so I thought I'd try Glendale's version. It was much more of a traditional sweet/spicy oil-based Pad Thai - whereas Indian School's version has more of a peanut sauce. It was heavy on the noodles, light on the tofu, but the flavor was good. It was spicy, but not what I would consider "hot." It included thin slices of carrots and red pepper, and a side of crushed peanuts and lime. There was plenty left over, and when I ate the leftovers today it was even better (the spices had settled in). However, I'll probably go back to the chow mein next time I visit.  My husband regularly gets the banh mi - beefless version - and a side of fries. He loves it, and gets it almost every visit. The fries are also exceptional - crisp and firm!  We've also had the pain au chocolat in the past and enjoyed it greatly!  I've read complaints about wait times at this restaurant, but never had any issues myself. I'm only out here a couple of times a year though, so I may not be a good judge of service. The counter people are always very friendly, and the place is clean and bright.

I am not a vegan and I do particularly enjoy the Surpreme Leader on television as it is strangely eerie to 1984; however., the food is amazing. The Hawaiian burger is delicious and the Carrot Cake is stellar. The wife loves the soup. Service can be alittle slow but take a good friend and just chill. Also, try all the flavors of ice tea.

If you're vegetarian or vegan because you like eating vegetables, unfortunately this is not the place for you. This place offers "mock meat" with very few veggies. Some things, like the Hawaiian burger, are good. But I don't feel very good after a meal without fresh veggies or fruit.  I do enjoy the drinks, though (Pink Lady has rose petals on top!), and I also like watching the other diners laughing at the cult-TV channel.
Delicious, decently priced vegan food. Now that they've taken down the Supreme Master TV broadcast the joint is even classier.

This is a great little gem, tucked away on a corner in North Phoenix. None of us in our group had ever been here before, and were greeted by a very friendly hostess and a clean, modern environment. Quick counter device with a nice sit down area made this a great choice for us.   I ordered the spring rolls and a Hawaiian hibiscus iced tea. The spring rolls were light and crispy, with fresh and flavorful vegetables. Their house made sweet and sour sauce was incredible. Sort of like an applesauce texture and great flavor.   The Hawaiian hibiscus tea was light and very refreshing, served in an old fashioned milkshake glass. My buddy got the Pho, and ate every last drop. He typically likes his Pho a little spicer, and noticed they have a spicy version he'll be trying next time.   If anyone is looking for delicious and healthy alternative for lunch, the Loving Hut is worth a try! We will definitely be back!
Being vegetarian I have been to Loving Hut many times.  The food and the atmosphere are great.  Service is always fast and friendly.
I am the total opposite of a vegan/vegetarian, but, OMG! The food here is delicious. I had the golden nuggets and the Spicy Cha-Cha and both were yummy! I will most definitely be coming back.

One of the best vegan restaurant  in town.  The food is flavorful and portions are big. My husband and I have our dinner  here regularly once/week  & we absolutely love this place The food is tasty, simple/clean environment, & friendly employees.

This is my second Loving Hut location visit, the first was in Phoenix. I was visiting some friends nearby and stopped here for lunch. The line was a bit long, waited about 10 minutes, and then I ordered spring rolls and spicy guru fried rice with a side of 2 cha cha shrimp ($1/a price! Pricey.) The woman at the counter let me know it would be a wait for my food, 15-25 minutes, which I appreciated. I got my number and sat at a table.   My appetizer came out within 5 minutes and the main dish after about 15, so the estimate was on the shorter side. I liked the rolls, simple and refreshing with veggies and tofu, love that rice paper. The dipping sauce was good but I could've used more. The spicy rice was yummy, not very spicy so I added Sriracha sauce to kick it up. The shrimp was delicious, love the fried taste and the texture it added.   Overall, a great choice for lunch/dinner with a variety of vegan options to please all.
The service is amazing. The soups are made with heart and soul! Especially the pho, which is always hot and very fresh. The place is very clean and the staff incredibly friendly and helpful.
This is the best Loving Hut in town. The Golden Beauty is money and I'm not even vegan.

What a great Vegetarian restaurant.  Food is fantastic, clean and neat atmosphere.  Servers are polite.  Menu has a huge selection.  I recommend this too all Vegetarians, and if you aren't, try it any way because you will love the food!

Worst place to go! I could have been a great customer, this is right by my kids daycare and a healthy option but never again! We got here at 5 it's 6:15 and still no food!!!! So much for an after school option. Lost my business forever.

Used to be good, maybe even great! But now, it is just MEH!  RIGHTS:  - Say they are vegan and they are  - Ordering is simple, fast and easy  - Complimentary soup is hot on a cold day  WRONGS:  - Our order was messed up, we got the wrong food served.  - Our pate chaud was cold, not hot as it should have been, then they just heated the same half eaten one and served it again  - We should have been comped, but no, we were given an itsy-bitsy (1.5 inch across) banana nut muffin. Yeah it was complimentary. Did you think I would pay for that!  - The TV and the program on it is annoying

Loving Hut is sooo good. I've been visiting incarnations of this store for 15 years (back when it was Suma Ching Hai), and they've only gotten better.  This is the place to go if you miss the regular dining experience and don't want to be a pain everywhere you go, then discover you can only have salad and french fries.   Loving Hut has everything. We have always been partial to their Asian dishes (a carryover preference from the old days, perhaps), so I can mostly only speak for that.   Keeping that in mind, I highly recommend:  Spring Rolls (the ones with peanut sauce) Noble Broccoli (great sauce) Sweet and Sour Pork (awesome fake meat thingies) The crispy chicken things (can't remember the name, lol... something about New York?), although I caution you to ask for it without the chili flakes, if you can't handle spice.  The lentil soup (huge) Banana cake Flan Pink Lady drink (It has soy milk, cranberry juice, and rose water in it. It's awesome!)  We haven't tried much else because these are so good, we haven't felt a need, really. We crave these dishes, and that's why we keep coming back. But I've heard the rest of it is great, too.  FYI: for three entrees, the spring roll appetizers, and maybe one dessert, we usually spend about $30 - $35.

Loving Hut is a multi-state chain restaurant that specializes in vegan food - and pretty damned good vegan food at that. However, let it be known that I'm no vegan and have absolutely no intention of converting to veganism. I hold no vegan powers and don't really like wearing beanies out of season, but that's beside the point. The fact is, my girlfriend and I came here with minimal expectations and were actually surprised in the end.  You order at the counter and should be prepared to wait. We were quoted 15-35 minutes and it ended up being closer to 15. We ordered their golden rolls, which are their take on eggrolls. Honestly, they were on par with what we'd order at any respectable restaurant that serves them.  For drinks, I was really hoping to try the Thai iced tea I saw posted on Yelp, but was told it was not available. They recommended an iced Mumbai chai for myself, while my girlfriend ordered the pink lady, which ended up looking more like a "lavender girl" for reasons unknown. Both were decent, even if I did have to go back to the counter and request that they add the cinnamon powder that they left off.  For main dishes, I played it safe, probably too safe, by ordering their blissful fried rice, sans the tofu. My girlfriend chose the chow mein with no modifications. What kind of surprised me was the BBQ beefless "protein," which looks and actually tastes very similar to actual meat. No, not mind-blowingly juicy meat, but similar to an average-tasting beef you'd get at a Chinese restaurant. How they pull this off remains a mystery, but it seems to work.  For dessert, we ordered the pain au chocolat, which are two pastries filled with dark chocolate and cookie butter. Additionally, we tried the pandan cake, which was something completely new. We were both a big fan of its unique flavor, as well as the addition of coconut.    Not everything was five-stars across the board, however. The service seemed to be a bit of a mess. The girl who I presumed to be the manager, told my girlfriend that there were a lot of new people there that didn't quite have the procedures down just yet. They not only forgot my cinnamon, but they also forgot our straws, so I had to track someone down since none of that stuff is available at the counter.  All the vegan propaganda littered about the restaurant is a bit weird and kind of overkill. Additionally, the preference for paying cash and slapping on a service fee for debit/credit payment seems odd for a restaurant that's a 38-state operated chain. Although it's a five-dollar minimum, so I doubt anyone will actually run into that problem.  Overall, I see this as a place that we'd definitely return to. Vegan or no vegan, the food is good and that's ultimately all that matters.
The food was VERY good! I had the Spicy shrimp salad-type bowl and it was amazing! I would definitely eat here again any time I'm passing through!

This restaurant never disappoints. Even my meat-eating fiancé loves it. It's really nice having vegan food close-by. I wish they were open on Sunday's but I get it, they need their time off too. I would love to see this location do a full renovation, the restaurant is cute but they could definitely upgrade to their full potential! I will always return to Loving Hut!

Given the limited options of vegetarian fare in Phoenix, this place is worth checking out. Nestled in the endless amounts of shopping strip malls, Loving Hut sticks out like a sore thumb with their spotless tables and fluorescent lighting.  ++ - menu has a good variety of Asian and "western" food, plus a whiteboard filled with new items available for selection - order and pay at front, sit and wait for your food, avoid servers breathing down your neck - the cute little Asian women who are so sweet I could take them home and have them cook for me all the time - clean clean clean!  - - - the "beef" in the vermicelli was overly chewy and too salty - wonton soup was pretty oily, could see droplets on the top of my soup - NO SRIRACHA?! (Asian hot sauce popularly known as Rooster sauce) - both TVs had breaking news about how we're destroying the planet via global warming and images of swine flu outbreak....not very appetizing...  I'd probably come again to try other things on their menu, but I'd prefer an ease up on the propaganda...

Tried this place out a couple weeks ago with my Fiancee. She is Vegan, I am not, but I'm very open to meat alternatives. We both really enjoyed our food. We started with the spring rolls, which had an excellent dipping sauce. I had the Jasmine Ice Tea that had a great flavor for an unsweetened Ice tea. My fiancee ordered the Sweet and Sour "Chicken" and really liked it, which is good as sometimes she does not like the fake meat. I ordered the Spicy Cha Cha, which is breaded soy shrimp. The breading was well seasoned, crispy and not greasy. I used the spring roll dipping sauce for the shrimp and would recommend getting a dipping sauce with this dish. All in all it was great experience. My fiancee's only suggestion is the have more veggie dishes not based on fake meats.

Loving Hut is adorable! The name in and of itself just screams it.  When you enter, you look at a menu, decide what you want, and go up to the cashier and order. They encourage you to pay with cash to keep food costs low. They have a variety of food items, all of which of course are vegan. Non-vegans, I encourage you to try this place, because they do not skimp out on flavor! I tried the Vietnamese sandwich and it really tasted like barbeque! They also have very yummy and interesting drinks. When we sat down they gave us complimentary soup before our ordered entrees!  I was pleasantly surprised by Loving Hut and plan on visiting again!

Let me start this review by getting a small rant out of the way, stick with me here. I understand people who are not vegan come here, some enjoy it, some don't. What I don't get is people spending half their review talking about how much they love meat, dairy, dead things that used to have a mother, etc :-). It makes you look like more of a jackass because you are lauding it at a restaurant that is explaining why to go Vegan all over the walls and TV!! Yes, I am a Vegan, but don't tell me I don't "understand", I was an omnivore for 28 years who used to eat lots of all kinds of meat, cheese, dairy and NEVER ever considered going Vegan - that argument doesn't fly with me. If you are interested there is a wealth of information out there so get educated. It's a process for most(like me) but a rewarding one and you might just surprise yourself. I am always willing to talk to anyone about my "experience" as what most of society would call me " a non traditional vegan".  Anyone still reading? Ok good, now onto Loving Hut. This review is really more of a 3-3.5 review but since it's a new vegan place in Phoenix metro it gets a 4 in my book. I think they could do much better in a better location, CenPho anyone? That being said, I work close by and this section of N Phx seems like anti-vegan land. So the fact that I have a 100% vegan place to go for lunch in this area is a bonus for me, although I am constantly going there alone since none of my coworkers would ever set foot in such a place(see "jackass" comment above).  Most of the food here is decent, the eggplant and tofu is a good dish with a side of brown rice. The BBQ sandwich is also very good. I enjoy most of their apps as well, I had the Hawaiian burger once and wasn't that impressed - I make a better veggie burger at home(probably healthier too). Don't mistake this for health food, but its better then your standard meal at the local Chili's. Let's face it, people don't go out to be as healthy as possible, everything in moderation though(well not EVERYTHING).  The staff is always very friendly and the prices seem reasonable on most of the dishes. I would rather create a Vegan meal at home then drive here for dinner, but for lunch when I need it, it works and I enjoy it. I hope they stay around and in business, I wouldn't be heartbroken though if they moved to an area where a vegan establishment might do better.  PS. They changed the names on the menu since they opened, I am not sure what prompted it but its a good change. I don't like any vegan places that includes the animal they are trying to imitate. Vegan food can stand on its own, soy, wheat, etc protein can stand on its own. It has its own flavor, texturee and benefits it doesnt need(nor should be) compared to something else. I get that calling something soy "chicken" helps with getting people to transition to the diet but call it what it is, soy meat, wheat meat, nut milk, nut meat etc. Animal by products don't have a monopoly on the word "meat" or "milk" or "cheese'. Kudos for the menu changes.
I can't believe a place this delicious actually exists. Everything I ate and drank here resulted in pure euphoria. I'll be back.

Awesome food!!! Great prices!  Good quality!  If you're looking for a place that is healthy and delicious, this is it! They also offer gluten free options.  Even if you're not a vegetarian, you should give them a try! And they grow their own herbs right here!

Let me start by saying this is the best vegan restaurant in Phoenix without doubt. The food here is amazing, even if you are a meat eater you will not miss meat.   As a vegan I find it hard to find well made vegan food and this place makes everything well worth the trip. From the  starters all the way to desert you will not be disappointed.   The serving staff are very helpful and remember you every time you come back in.   My favorites are the burgers, the curries and the hot Mumbai chai.   Give it a try you will not leave disappointed!

for a long time, i was the only vegetarian in my circle of friends / high school class, and so when one of my mates became a vegetarian after a year of tentative debating with herself, that prompted whatever electric current in my brain that transliterates to something along the lines of, 'now i can look for vegan/vegetarian restaurants and not be worried about eating alone'! i love loving hut. the two of us had been very afraid that when we came here we were going to experience something along the lines of tina fey's romantic encounter in baby mama, where they confusingly [try to] eat a yeast ball. it was not so. their menu items are confusingly meatlike in texture, although i have no idea how close the flavours are to meat.   here are individual dish reviews: arigato sushi: these sushi rolls are good, although there is better vegetable sushi to be found elsewhere. they taste strongly of the pickles, mostly. spring rolls: i enjoy the spring rolls a lot, most likely due to the use of jicama. the leek is too strong for me (which is not very bizarre, for someone who hates onions). pâté chaud: although i have never had meat pâté, i somehow doubt this competes very well with it. it was mostly puff pastry and very little filling. golden nuggets: these are very perfect for anyone craving something small and crispy with a token flavour. it would not constitute a meal, which is why they are listed in the appetizer section- these are minuscule. hawaiian burger: i love pineapple + it is so hard to go wrong with a burger, in my opinion, so this is a pretty easy success. sometimes the paddies restaurants offer are disgusting (boca, yuck), but this one seems to be made in house. their french fries are thankfully crisp and not dried out or soggy. bbq baguette: a bit on the minimalistic side, the flavours here are all good and well, and the bbq soy protein tastes good but sometimes has questionably unsettling texture when eaten alone (e.g. if it falls out of your baguette). the sandwich filling to baguette ratio is maybe 1:3- not very meaty. bbq vermicelli: i am not a peanut fan (and this is topped with peanuts), but those are negligible and can be pushed aside. i would definitely recommend this, as this is the first item that my partner ordered when we ate here that long, long time ago. the only difficulty we had was using the chopsticks to handle everything at once. the vermicelli was good when we ate it and not over/undercooked. we have ordered this many times. spicy cha cha: this is essentially the vegan version of fried shrimp. this is the first thing i ate when i came here on account of the first two things i attempted to order being out of stock. it is really impressive that they even have those strange red stripes on their pseudo shrimp, which has a bit of a spongey consistency (that is visible if examined). the flavour is well composed and cohesive throughout. when it comes to spice, if you are a gringo, you probably do not want this, although i think for most people it is very mild. carrot cake: this cake is wonderful and has a very nice combination of sweet flavours; it is especially good with a coffee drink on the side, or soy milk. banana cake: this cake is a little more dry than their carrot cake, but otherwise since i am not as fond of banana flavoured things that are not bananas, my opinion of this dish is pretty heavily biased. banana fritters: if you like banana fritters, there is no reason not to get these. these are good. they are not spectacular but are very far from terrible. this has real bananas in it obviously so it is not influenced by that bias. pink lady: my partner orders this every single time we come here. she loves it to an amount i could never quantify. sometimes toward the bottom of the glass it begins to taste mostly like flowers, which is cool if you are THAT kind of vegan. sunny forest: it is a perfect combination of orange and mint. sometimes i wish they would put a little more sparkling water in it. this is my drink of choice, and i will order it every time i come here.  orange joy: because i love orange juice, i automatically think that this is good. the cranberry juice adds a nice bit of tartness in combination. happy go lucky: hey, if you like lemon and lime together with a subtle hint of rose, this is probably for you! i think it is kind of boring compared to their other drinks, which are a little stronger, with more body. ice mumbai spirit: i have only had this once; this is a good iced chai. if i remember correctly, it was slightly less sweet than the chai you get from most coffee shops, but all of the spice flavour is there.  enjoy! that is all that i can remember off of the top of my head.
Great vegan food with so many options!! The iced chai was delicious as were the "chicken" nuggets!

Well obviously vegan.... so good that you wouldn't realize it was vegan.   I think the biggest thing you need to know about loving hut is that your food order will take a long time to come out. It is well worth the wait because everything is super fresh but you will wait.  I tired their mint limeaide. Very refreshing. I really enjoy the pandan cake. Tastes like a pistachio butter cake.   They have a large freezer full of frozen vegan protein alternatives.   They are a cash preferred store and will charge .25 for under $5.   You can get delivery through door dash.

If you're vegan and even if you aren't (yet), the food here will blow you away. The BBQ "beef" noodle dish was fantastic. I don't know how they get TVP chunks to taste like beef but it does. Very satisfying meal. I can't wait to go again, even though I live in the central plateau.

This place has great tasting food considering its 100% Vegan. The staff was very welcoming, friendly, and attentive. I had the chili burger with fries, and even though I could definitely taste the difference between what I was eating, and a regular chili burger, it was still very enjoyable and satisfying. I will definitely be returning to this location.

The food is not only healthy but extremely flavorful. I ordered the spicy pad Thai and the spring rolls. Both were amazing. I ordered my pad Thai less spicy and it was perfect.  I also ordered the chrysanthemum tea, sent it back for the green tea that tasted much better.  I finished off with the chocolate cake. A little dry but very flavorful.      The only thing I would change is the order set up
Always impressed with their food! So delicious and healthy! Service is always kind and thorough. Place is always clean! A must!

Really good food and an incredible menu. I really enjoyed the noble broccoli with brown rice.  The curry Devine was really good and a really good size. I asked for it spicy and they were able to accommodate me.  My wife is vegan so that is why I originally came here. Now I request to go here. My only problem was I waited 50 minutes on a Takeout order that I phoned ahead and was told 25 minutes. But it was worth the wait.

Coming here is the highlight of my day, girlfriend turned me vegan and i am very picky on what i eat. All i use to have was American styled food (burgers and hotdogs), but i had the occasional Chinese food. I gave this place a try and am glad i did. Doesn't taste like what i use to eat, it is ten times better. The atmosphere is wonderful, nice and clean. The workers are very nice and my girlfriend applied to work there, so we met the owner and she is a really nice woman. They have TVs playing with vegan recipes sometimes and i love getting new ideas to try at home. All in all a great place to try vegan or not.
I love to eat healthy. (even though i do eat meat) i still thought this place was pretty amazing my boyfriend (another meat eater) and i have decided to make it our regular place :)

I love healthy food. But the vegan restaurants usually have so much attitude or arrogant  "regulars". This place didn't have that. The food was very fresh. It was little expensive for what it was, but I don't mind. Overall I liked it.    If you don't like vegan food don't eat here. It really is just veggies and tofu. Some vegan places have meat for your friend that doesn't like veggies but this place only had tofu.

There's something for everyone at Loving Hut!  From Burgers, Hotdogs and Fries to Stir Fry, Chinese, and a wide variety of rice/noodle dishes. Everything I've tried is incredible, flavorful, healthy, and cruelty-free! The.benefits are endless and to have a local hot spot like 'Loving Hut' in the area it is in, is a blessing!  Recommended items:  Hawaiian Burger Spaghetti Wontons Pho Sweet & Sour Divine And any of their stir fry rice dishes!

Omg, Loving Hut, you are so delicious!! You need to be next to my house, feeding me all the things on your menu all the time!! Yes, I would be the size of a house! No, I do not care!  Oh, hey there, Yelp reader....  Everything is vegan. You must know this up front. That means: NO meat, NO dairy, NO animal products. You must not be like my Dad and repeatedly say, 'This isn't a burger! There's no MEAT in it!' No, Dad, you knew this going in. Stop it, you're embarrassing me.  Don't be that guy.  That said: the menu is huge. American food (burgers, spaghetti (wait, that might be considered Italian), chicken nuggets); Chinese food (chow mein, sweet and sour tofu, miso soup); Indian food (curry and whatnot). Lots of stuff. I can't remember it all! Go look at their menu online; they have PICTURES!  I've been to the Loving Hut in San Francisco, so I know this stuff is good. This time I got the curry fried rice (Guru Rice I think it was called?). Spicy and delicious, just like I like it! Sprinkled with small chunks of tofu. I would have preferred larger chunks, but that's just me.  My Dad got brown rice because he is a big baby. He liked it.  My boyfriend got the sweet and sour tofu, and he LOVED it. He said it was the perfect combination of sweet and sour, but it leaned more sweet (which he prefers).  My Mom was sadly disappointed by her Buddy Burger-- she said it was too chewy. She did, however, love the 'Golden Nuggets' (aka 'chicken' nuggets) w/ sweet ketchup, and she loved her french fries. I tried the french fries-- personally, I recommend you add some more salt, but again, that's just me.  The prices are reasonable-- $5.50 for Mom's burger and $7.50 for my fried rice dish. The portions are big, in my opinion, so I found the prices fair. I even have leftovers!  Grab a menu when you come in, choose what you'd like, go to the front counter and order what you want by number (each meal is numbered). If you can't decide, like me, go with something that has a heart-shape next to it-- that means it's a House Favorite and you practically can't go wrong!  Loving Hut prefers you pay in cash (they have an explanation for it, read it if you want), but they absolutely accept credit and debit cards.  This location is on the corner of 35th Ave. and Union Hills, at the very end of the row closest to 35th Ave.  I'm a vegetarian, wannabe vegan, and my Mom is a vegetarian as well. However, my Dad and his prejudices aside, this IS a place you can take your non-veggie friends and family to as well. The layout is clean and it's not like it shoves vegetarianism down your throat (that might not be the best analogy...). You know what I mean. Don't be afraid to bring your non-veggie friends to this place, that's all I'm saying. :)

I'm a big fan of the Loving Hut and Loving Café chains. This is the largest one I've ever been in! Staff was super friendly, and as usual, the only troubling issue is choosing a menu item or two. I'm a Loving Hut Super Fan.

We have been vegan now for about 9 months.  We don't eat out as much as we use to, since we have found it more convenient to make vegan meals at home.  However, as we continue our journey, we are finding more places to go.  5 years ago, if you'd have told me I would be eating at a vegan restaurant called "The Loving Hut"; I would have told you that you're crazy.  Today, if you told me I couldn't go to the The Loving Hut, I'd go crazy!  We started eating at The Loving Hut about 2 months ago.  I have tried a different meal each time we go (unusual for me, usually I find something I like and stick with it), and I have not been disappointed yet.  The restaurant is clean, light, and bright.  When you enter, there is a counter in front of you with menus.  While we normally figure out ahead of time what we are having (we have a take out menu at home); you can peruse the menu and make your choice.  You then walk up to the counter and place your order.  They will give you an number and bring your food out to you.  Special note, while it is a counter service restaurant, your meal may take time to prepare and it's worth the wait.  My understanding is that each Loving Hut is different.  This one is asian themed, although "burgers" are on the menu.  My favorite meal so far has been the Spicy Guru Fried Rice (#34) which is a fried rice with Indian curry.  The taste is wonderful, and the portion is huge.  Other meals that I have had and liked?  Noble Noodle Bowl, Golden Vermicelli (huge!), Golden Beauty, and the Blissful Fried Rice (also huge and very good).  The only meal that I was not crazy about was the Save the Planet Curry.  It was served as a soup and was very good, however it has chunks of tofu in it and they were rather rubbery.    All in all, we have enjoyed every visit so far, the place is spotless, the staff is friendly, and the food has been great!

While on vacation we chose Loving Hut because of the great reviews.  It was a trek to get there and very unassuming as we drove up... WOW....So Good I was texting everyone I knew as we left.  We are not vegetarian YET...but as my husband said "why would you eat animal protein when food can taste so good without it." We ate and ate without guilt....Oh, and sample the drinks.  It's like drinking nature...seriously!    We had planned to go out for BBQ tonite but we are going back to Loving Hut instead.

This was my first time going here with my husband. I have been plant based for a month, and it has been hard finding places to eat out. We came here, after reading the great reviews, expecting an average experience. It was anything but that. The people were amazing, the food excellent, they ambiance very pleasant, and the pricing good. I have finally found a place where I can go and eat anything without fear of derailing my current did lifestyle. Kudos to this place

Loving the Loving Hut, is that redundant?  Who knew vegan could be so good?  I'm not a vegan or even a vegetarian, I just like food, and the dishes here could almost make me consider changing my meat eating ways.  I love the Mongolian Wonder,  Spicy Pad Thai, and the Golden  Delight, a lemongrass 'chikn'.  Then there is the broth they give you at the start of the meal, it's a light and flavorful broth with a few vegetables  and a  little tofu in it, so simple yet oh so tasty.  The atmosphere is so relaxing and you feel better having eaten a meal here. I can't wait to get back to the valley and try something else on their extensive menu.

Absolutely love this restaurant. The food is of the best quality and always made to order. I love the curry with veggies and the springrolls. A must try is the pinklady mocktail.......cranberryjuice and soymilk over ice .... yummy! The staff is always super friendly and the restaurant is very clean.

Absolutely fantastic!!! I had the seaweed ocean, my mom had the sweet and sour divine, we both had water and chocolate cake. We will definitely come again. The seaweed ocean was huge, tasted like tuna, soft, flaky, tender, scrumptious! I ordered it with a side of white rice. I don't know how they cook the rice, but it tasted great, not like boring white rice at all! The sauce that came with the seaweed ocean tasted good but was a little salty. The sweet and sour tasted exactly like sweet and sour chicken. Very tasty, not too sweet, not spicy, tender, delicious. The water had fresh oranges in it. The cake was fabulous! Moist, not too sweet, buttery creamy frosting. It could have had a little more chocolate though. Pretty restaurant. Fast service. Quiet relaxing spot. I wish they did breakfast!

Wow. I mean... WOW. I'm a HUGE Meat lover... every main meal I eat MUST have meat or chicken in it. But this place really proved me wrong and I'm still amused.  My husband took me here for lunch and it was our first times here. He ordered the "spicy noodle broth bowl" and I ordered the "BBQ + egg roll vermicelli". It was absolutely delicious and healthy.   The protein part of the dish looks like meat (but its not), and tastes good. I can't even explain what it tastes like... but it really satisfies my need for meat. My dish was about $9 and I would definitely get it again.  We will be back to try other items!!

Let me preface this by saying, not all Loving Huts prepare their food the same. I ordered the spicy cha cha having had it numerous times before in Cali. When I got my order I was confused as to why there a bunch of chopped up bell peppers mixed in with the shrimp. Needless to say, it wasn't spicy because of the red pepper flake goodness I'm used to. It actually wasn't spicy at all. At least I know now to stick with the Cali establishments.

Happy to see that a vegan restaurant has finally come to my neighborhood. My sister and I were immediately greeted by a member of the courteous and helpful staff who offered us a complimentary mushroom soup. There are several things to choose from and finally decided to start with the spring rolls and each ordered the be-veg lunch(which included asparagus, tofu,and white rice), mumbai spirit to drink and carrot cake for dessert.  All were fresh and delicious and the menu prices are very reasonable. I will soon be returning to try more!

Very disappointing. I will not be back nor will I recommend this restaurant to anyone.   Everything here *looks* really good, but didn't live up to it's presentation. Ordered the spring rolls to start, Pink Lady drink (mixture of pomegranate juice and soy milk) and the Chow Mein. Sadly, nothing tasted good.   My friends I went with were also disappointed with their food. None of us finished our dishes.   Oh well. Too bad!   Go to True Foods in the Biltmore area instead. It's worth it!

Excellent, excellent, excellent. It's so great to have a restaurant that is 100% vegan so that you have no worries of making the wrong choice.  The good thing is you could take anyone there and they'd be happy.  They would have no idea it's vegan.  In addition, depending on the location you have many choices to choose from ranging from Asian inspiration to burgers and fries.  I had a Pink Lady drink which was very tasty.  For our main course we each chose the Hawaiian burger with fries.  Unknowingly we also receive soup as an appetizer.  Both items we FANTASTIC. Highly recommend.

If the opening of a new vegetarian restaurant is cause for me to celebrate, just imagine how happy I was after I tasted the food!  Jeremy and I checked Loving Hut on Friday for dinner.  It's a really cute place, spotlessly clean and the staff is very sweet and helpful with suggestions.  I had the steak sandwich (one of their chef's choice dishes) and it was great!  The steak itself was delicious, served on crusty french bread with crisp marinated veggies.  I had a beautiful orange-cranberry juice drink called the Orange Joy as well.  Mmmmm!  I can't wait to go back again this week and try something new.  Everything looks great and I'm so pleased to have a veggie place on the north side of town.

Alrighty, a friend highly recommended this little place so I followed.   Its quaint, clean, and the employees (I was greeted by a caucasian female with lighter hair) are very very kind. But this review isnt really about them, because they made the experienced, well, good.  I ordered the "beef" noodle rolls to go. They come with a side of dipping sauce. And contained rice noodles, spinach, and some protein made to imitate beef, they were wrapped in a rice wrap (the name escapes me). Those were the okay parts. But not much flavor really. And it was really just one big gooy sticky mess. The rolls should be fried to add a different texture, and to make the experience less "taffy" like. However, the yellow daikon (fermented) and carrots, were so over powering, thats all I could taste! And Im Korean! I live for this stuff!  It was off putting, and I felt very disatisfied after finishing the first roll that I didnt touch the second one.   Ill eventually try the other items on the menu, but for now, Im staying away.

The food here is fantastic and the staff are polite. I had the Hawaiian burger, and it was pretty bomb. It's great to get a delicious meal and have it be animal-product free and environmentally friendly here in the Valley.

I FRIKKIN LOVE THIS FRIKKIN PLACE!!   When you walk in, you're greeted by a hostess stand with no hostess but plenty of menus. Once you decide what you want you go up the the order counter. They don't have waitresses and all that good stuff. Who needs that when you serve amazing cruelty free food!??  I've had the spicy fried rice, Golden rolls, vermicelli bowl, pho, the red Soup with lemon grass and spices, and the Thai basil plus many more to come. Everything is IMPECCABLE! There is no flavor lacking. Everything is better here than I have ever eaten as a non-vegan.   I am vegan for the animals. But this place is vegan for the animals and the environment. They ooze with positive vibes which I love.   Prices are good. Food is good. Service is good. I love everything here. And everyone should go. You suck if you're not vegan But you should go here whether you're vegan or not.
Food is great, you don't miss the meat, and I'm making the planet happy.  I'm also not supporting Industrial Livestock Production which makes me happy.

Pretty good overall restaurant. Lots of variety in their menu. Need to be open to trying new things. Glad it's totally vegan though there is a lot of soy used and I wish they used non-GMO.   Their staff is nice and friendly, too.

I love this place. Spicy Cha Cha is awesome. I love the drinks--I've had iced lemongrass tea and iced hibiscus tea. Delicious. I can't wait 'til next time--hoping I'll save room to try a dessert.  Sparkling clean and friendly staff who aren't too intrusive with the chatting.
their smoothies are divine and any soup there is delicious!

My FAVORITE vegan restaurant. The staff is always extremely friendly and helpful both when I am dining in or placing a to go order. They're also always so kind when taking special requests on food which is a lot of times rare. The save the planet curry is unlike any other soup I've had and I could probably eat it every day. I've tried more than half the menu and all the desserts (here too much) and have yet to find something I don't like. Definitely recommend to all vegans and non vegans :)
Is been a long time since we've been here,  and I don't know why!  The food here is amazing and the service prefect.   They had a few new menu items,  the mighty mint limeade is a must have.

My absolute favorite restaurant to date.  Good vegan food.  Fast service.  No pretense.  You just know you're going to walk away feeling good about your food choices and healthier for it.  Highly recommended to any and all.  You don't have to be vegan or vegetarian to enjoy this good food.

I was eager to try this place. My husband is a meat and potatoes kind of guy, but I convinced him to come along. I was still worried, though--I wanted him to like his food. The propaganda aspect worried me a little but it wasn't that bothersome. The TVs are at a very low volume.  I advised him to get the #44 Mongolian Wonder because of the Yelp reviews. I ordered the #55 Phoenix Leisure. Our two cups of water and broth soon came out. The broth appetizer was quite good.  The food soon followed. It smelled great and the proportions weren't bad at all; it looked exactly as depicted on the menu. Looking at other tables, the soup bowls are enormous, too. My husband was pleasantly surprised by his food. He said the texture was a little off of beef but it was good. He ate it all without any complaint, and I gave him most of my brown rice, too.  My dish was good, too. The rainbow salad wasn't anything spectacular but it WAS much better than the side salads you get at most other restaurants. It had a great crunch and the colors were pretty. The protein was excellent; sauce had excellent savory flavor. The vegetables were perfectly cooked--crispy, not mushy. The brown rice was perfectly steamed.  If this restaurant was closer to where I lived, I'd probably visit on a regular basis. There are a number of other things on the menu I'd love to try.

I'm giving loving hut four stars. I think this is a unique little joint! All vegeterian, vegan options. I went one day for lunch, got the Hawaiian vegeterian burger with a lemonade and the cabbage salad. Vegetarian options are becoming more popular now a days but it's still hard sometimes to find a place that makes the food the way you like it. Loving but does great and the options are endless! Cute hippie vibes abt this place too which I adored!!
Love Loving Hut! Employees are always so helpful and very pleasant! Food always top notch. The lemongrass tea is soooo delicious!
I love their curry soup and chai tea..it's my favorite!! This place is clean and the employees  great. I'm not vegetarian or vegan, but I love this place.
The ambiance is warm and welcoming. The food is fragrant and delicious. Even our 6 year old enjoyed himself. Very satisfying!
Sorry about the pic with meal almost gone. They have a lot of options and choices. Steady flow of satisfied customers. If you have never tried it, treat yourself and a friend. Enjoy!

Tried it couple weeks ago and even went back soon after!  Impressed with the variety of vegan entrees the menu offers (chili dogs!) the food is great and the curry is a stand out.  The staff was very helpful on both occasions despite a steady group of diners while we were there.  My one complaint is regarding the two TV's in the dining area. On each occasion they were showing an international QVC like channel. Culture is an amazing thing yet couldn't one tv have a more familiar show?

Had lunch for the first time here today. We are not vegan but we really enjoyed the food here. Portion was larger than we expected. We are not used to eating tofu and soy protein but enjoyed the flavors and texture of the meal. The presentation was pretty and very appetizing. Food looks exactly like the picture on the menu. Don't forget to try the fresh juices as well. Yum! Service was friendly and quick. I won't even have to trick my husband in to coming back.

Took my 3 daughters in today - -only to see a PETA video playing. Not exactly appetizing. When i kindly asked if he could change the channel, he snapped "NO".  .... what?! are you kidding me??? who wants to eat lunch while someone is torturing chickens?! I will NEVER patron it again. Just awful!

There are not a lot of places that are vegan around here... I  get the "non-chicken" chicken wings for the boy. I feel good about him not eating nuggets at Mc something. Yuck! GMO gag! Anyways, I like the "golden bbq vermicelli". We tried the Pho was so so.

Short story: This place is great.  Loved the food.  Liked the prices. Loved the deserts.  You'd probably only know that you're in a vegan restaurant because they tell you (I haven't been a vegan all my life - it's something I do but it's not a religion).  So, vegan or not, this place is the bomb.  And for those who aren't vegan, you can eat here and be satisfied when you leave.  Or, it's a great place to bring a group that is part vegan and part non-vegan.  Everybody wins.  I highly recommend it.
